item.title: What is your top track, and why do you think it was so successful?
item.dc:creator: Ninjendo
item.description:
My song At Dawn was probably successful for the vibes. The tone of the song really fits the genre and plenty of dedication to the creativity of the project shows throughout the song. In my perspective, I think people thought it was an underrated song and many people reposted it. Really happy how the song turned out.
Link: https://soundcloud.com/octavomusic/at-dawn

Read full topic

item.source: What is your top track, and why do you think it was so successful?

item.title: What is your top track, and why do you think it was so successful?
item.dc:creator: AzureOnyx
item.description:
For awhile, Retrowave was the top track for me, probably because of the trend of 80s having a comeback ever since Stranger Things became popular.

However, back in March, Five Fragments of a Fox became the most popular track for me by a long shot, most likely because of the fact that the devs reposted this on their SoundCloud.

Both of these songs did have progression in it; Retrowave went from a simple drumbeat to drum and bass, FFoaF had chiptune, trance-inspired rhythms, and a pitch change.

If I had to choose which ones were my favorite, the answer would be none of them. If i‚Äôm being honest, I hate hearing FFoaF because it sounded too close to a basic indie-game soundtrack, something I struggle to avoid. I hated Retrowave because is was popularized by trends.

Retrowave - https://soundcloud.com/azureonyx/retrowave
FFoaF - https://soundcloud.com/azureonyx/five-fragments-of-a-fox

Read full topic

item.title: What is your top track, and why do you think it was so successful?
item.dc:creator: Aadam
item.description:
Heatwave or Lights That Dim, They both have very epic final drops, one is trance and one is sad, so you can choose. I also thought Hybrid was pretty good because it is quiet and uses different mixing styles. Link for heatwave is here and lights that dim is here. If you want to hear Hybrid, then click here. My other most successful one is Lights That Shine. Link for Lights That Shine: click here.

item.title: What is your top track, and why do you think it was so successful?
item.dc:creator: NorthEast
item.description:
My top track was one with me and @Fokkses called Remember. I couldn‚Äôt link it if I wanted to, but you can look up Fokkses‚Äô SoundCloud and find it there.

I think it was most successful because I did a collab on it, and with my luck, I was working with one of the greatest artists on this app at that time. I feel if I did a collab again, I‚Äôd be much smarter and I could actually help along the way instead of making up my mind on what others did to my work.

Read full topic

item.title: What is your top track, and why do you think it was so successful?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
HYDRANS:

it surprises me that a soundcloud account with 88K followers and 1.8M yt subs only gets you 5K plays‚Ä¶

The average repost only generates plays equal to 3-4% of that channel‚Äôs following.

cite: http://heroic.academy/soundcloud-reposts-white-paper/

Read full topic

item.title: What is your top track, and why do you think it was so successful?
item.dc:creator: foryou
item.description:
HYDRANS:

sidenote: it surprises me that a soundcloud account with 88K followers and 1.8M yt subs only gets you 5K plays‚Ä¶

it surprises me that you still find new ways to criticize my musicü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è but honestly since their main focuses are their youtube channel and their spotify page, the majority of their soundcloud followers aren‚Äôt extremely active. and most of the people that saw it on youtube probably wouldn‚Äôt go search for my soundcloud and listen there when they could just as easily play the youtube version.
